intro: Gastrolepis austrocaledonica, commonly known as the Southern Kerguelen buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the subantarctic region of the Southern Ocean. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native environment. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stability. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
